name: Hide Admin Dashboard Notifications
author: WP-Belo

sections.description: The Hide Admin Dashboard Notifications plugin enables you to disable dashboard notifications for specific or all admin users. This enables admin users to focus on more important tasks on the system which boosts productivity.
sections.installation:
Installation from within WordPress

  1. Visit Plugins > Add New.
  2. Search for Hide Admin Dashboard Notifications.
  3. Install and activate the Hide Admin Dashboard Notifications plugin.

Manual installation

  1. Upload the entire belo-hide-admin-notifications folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Visit Plugins.
  3. Activate the Hide Admin Dashboard Notifications plugin.

After activation

  1. Select the Hide dashboard notifications menu.
  2. By default all admin users are included, select the admin to hide the notifications and click save.

Support for translation

  • Included
sections.faq:
What is the purpose of this plugin?

This plugin disables dashoard unnecessary notifications for specifically selected admin users

Where can I submit my plugin feedback?

Especially since this is a collection of WordPress core feature plugins, providing feedback is encouraged and much appreciated! You can submit your feedback either in the plugin support forum or, if you have a specific issue to report, in its GitHub repository.

How can I contribute to the plugin?

Contributions welcome! There are several ways to contribute:

  • Raise an issue or submit a pull request in the Github repository for the plugin
  • Translate the plugin into your language at translate.wordpress.org
  • Join the weekly chat (Tuesdays at 16:00 UTC) in the #performance channel on Slack
sections.changelog:

Initial release

1.0.2

Version upgrade, latest wordpress verison compatible, plugin interface updated
